description: Provides metrics on the accuracy of the models that were trained by the  CreatePredictor operation. Use metrics to see how well the model performed and to decide whether to use the predictor to generate a forecast. For more information, see Predictor Metrics. This operation generates metrics for each backtest window that was evaluated. The number of backtest windows ( NumberOfBacktestWindows) is specified using the  EvaluationParameters object, which is optionally included in the CreatePredictor request. If NumberOfBacktestWindows isn't specified, the number defaults to one. The parameters of the filling method determine which items contribute to the metrics. If you want all items to contribute, specify zero. If you want only those items that have complete data in the range being evaluated to contribute, specify nan. For more information, see  FeaturizationMethod.

parameters.name: PredictorArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the predictor to get metrics for.

nested_items.name: PredictorEvaluationResults
nested_items.description: An array of results from evaluating the predictor.

nested_items.name: AlgorithmArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the algorithm that was evaluated.

nested_items.name: TestWindows
nested_items.description: The array of test windows used for evaluating the algorithm. The NumberOfBacktestWindows from the  EvaluationParameters object determines the number of windows in the array.

nested_items.name: TestWindowStart
nested_items.description: The timestamp that defines the start of the window.

nested_items.name: TestWindowEnd
nested_items.description: The timestamp that defines the end of the window.

nested_items.name: ItemCount
nested_items.description: The number of data points within the window.

nested_items.name: EvaluationType
nested_items.description: The type of evaluation.
SUMMARY - The average metrics across all windows.
COMPUTED - The metrics for the specified window.

nested_items.name: RMSE
nested_items.description: The root-mean-square error (RMSE).

nested_items.name: WeightedQuantileLosses
nested_items.description: An array of weighted quantile losses. Quantiles divide a probability distribution into regions of equal probability. The distribution in this case is the loss function.

nested_items.name: Quantile
nested_items.description: The quantile. Quantiles divide a probability distribution into regions of equal probability. For example, if the distribution was divided into 5 regions of equal probability, the quantiles would be 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, and 0.8.

nested_items.name: LossValue
nested_items.description: The difference between the predicted value and the actual value over the quantile, weighted (normalized) by dividing by the sum over all quantiles.

nested_items.name: ErrorMetrics
nested_items.description: Provides detailed error metrics for each forecast type. Metrics include root-mean square-error (RMSE), mean absolute percentage error (MAPE), mean absolute scaled error (MASE), and weighted average percentage error (WAPE).

nested_items.name: ForecastType
nested_items.description: The Forecast type used to compute WAPE, MAPE, MASE, and RMSE.

nested_items.name: WAPE
nested_items.description: The weighted absolute percentage error (WAPE).

nested_items.name: RMSE
nested_items.description: The root-mean-square error (RMSE).

nested_items.name: MASE
nested_items.description: The Mean Absolute Scaled Error (MASE)

nested_items.name: MAPE
nested_items.description: The Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE)

nested_items.name: AverageWeightedQuantileLoss
nested_items.description: The average value of all weighted quantile losses.

nested_items.name: IsAutoPredictor
nested_items.description: Whether the predictor was created with  CreateAutoPredictor.

nested_items.name: AutoMLOverrideStrategy
nested_items.description: The AutoML strategy used to train the predictor. Unless LatencyOptimized is specified, the AutoML strategy optimizes predictor accuracy.

nested_items.name: OptimizationMetric
nested_items.description: The accuracy metric used to optimize the predictor.
